As hundreds of migrants tried to cross the fence from Guatemala and Mexico on friday federal police fired tear gas to keep them back as James Frederick reports from Mexico a caravan has not turned
Back the bridge connecting Guatemala and Mexico is now a makeshift refugee camp is night fell in rain came pouring down most of the thousands of migrants in the caravans stayed on the bridge while some returned to Guatemala in search of water food and medical attention
Next steps for the caravan are unclear but Mexico's human rights commission says migration authorities would be slowly letting women and children into the country at least one hundred and fifty had been allowed into Mexico and take into sheltered so far authorities say they will continue to gradually allow people across the border
